vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 4366, as amended; A bill making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1121
vote.title: Lee Amdt. No. 1121; To require congressional review of certain agency rulemaking.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1249
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 1249; To ensure that United States diplomats and officials of the U.S. Section of the International Boundary and Water Commission are able to advance efforts seeking compliance by the United Mexican States with the 1944 Treaty on Utilization of Waters of the Colorado and Tijuana Rivers and of the Rio Grande.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1347
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 1347; To reduce the amounts appropriated in divisions B and C and to rescind amounts appropriated to the Internal Revenue Service.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1217
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 1217; To require a full audit of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and the Federal reserve banks by the Comptroller General of the United States.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1243
vote.title: Budd Amdt. No. 1243; To prohibit the use of funds to implement or enforce Executive Order 14019.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1296
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 1296; To prohibit using funds to pay the salary of an individual who was nominated to the position of Administrator of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and whose nomination was subsequently withdrawn.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1200
vote.title: Hawley Amdt. No. 1200; To prohibit the use of funds for providing grants, funding, or any financial benefit to Chinese entities.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1182

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1232
vote.title: Lankford Amdt. No. 1232; To provide for a period of continuing appropriations in the event of a lapse in appropriations under the normal appropriations process, and establish procedures and consequences in the event of a failure to enact appropriations.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1354
vote.title: Kennedy Amdt. No. 1354; To prohibit the availability of funds for the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to report certain information to the Department of Justice for use by the National Instant Criminal Background Check System.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1237
vote.title: Rubio Amdt. No. 1237; To prohibit the use of funds to implement the final rule regarding energy efficient standards for certain subsidized housing.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1210
vote.title: Vance Amdt. No. 1210; To prohibit funds appropriated for the Department of Transportation for fiscal year 2024 from being used to enforce a mask mandate in response to the COVID-19 virus.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 2226, As Amended; An original bill to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2024 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1087
vote.title: Reed Amdt. No. 1087; To provide for a manager's amendment.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 523
vote.title: Rubio Amdt. No. 523; To provide that sums in the Thrift Savings Fund may not be invested in securities that are listed on certain foreign exchanges.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1078
vote.title: Schatz Amdt. No. 1078; To reauthorize the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 638
vote.title: Menendez Amdt. No. 638; To reauthorize the Firefighter Cancer Registry Act of 2018.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1058
vote.title: Hawley Amdt. No. 1058; To extend the period for filing claims under the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act and to provide for compensation under such Act for claims relating to Manhattan Project waste, and to improve compensation for workers involved in uranium mining.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1065
vote.title: Gillibrand Amdt. No. 1065; To amend title XXXIII of the Public Health Service Act with respect to funding for the World Trade Center Health Program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1034
vote.title: Kennedy Amdt. No. 1034; To prohibit allocations of Special Drawing Rights at the International Monetary Fund for perpetrators of genocide and state sponsors of terrorism without congressional authorization.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 874
vote.title: Marshall Amdt. No. 874; To prohibit the flying, draping, or other display of any flag other than the flag of the United States at public buildings.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1030
vote.title: Sanders Amdt. No. 1030; To reduce military spending.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 999
vote.title: Barrasso Amdt. No. 999; To require the Secretary of Energy to establish a Nuclear Fuel Security Program, expand the American Assured Fuel Supply Program, establish an HALEU for Advanced Nuclear Reactor Demonstration Projects Program, and submit a report on a civil nuclear credit program, and to enhance programs to build workforce capacity to meet critical mission needs of the Department of Energy.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 438
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 438; To provide for the independent and objective conduct and supervision of audits and investigations relating to the programs and operations funded with amounts appropriated or otherwise made available to Ukraine for military, economic, and humanitarian aid.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1055
vote.title: Wicker Amdt. No. 1055; To establish the Office of the Lead Inspector General for Ukraine Assistance.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 421
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 421; To provide remedies to members of the Armed Forces discharged or subject to adverse action under the COVID-19 vaccine mandate.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 199
vote.title: Warnock Amdt. No. 199; To provide enhanced protection against debt collector harassment of members of the Armed Forces.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 813
vote.title: Rounds Amdt. No. 813; To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 to include the Secretary of Agriculture on the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States and require review of certain agricultural transactions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 931
vote.title: Cornyn Amdt. No. 931; To provide for an investment screening mechanism relating to covered sectors.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 376
vote.title: Lee Amdt. No. 376; To limit the availability of funds for the support of Ukraine.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 926
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 926; To prohibit the export or sale of petroleum products from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to certain entities.

vote.question: On the Nomination

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation: Joseph Lee Falk, of Florida, to be a Member of the Board of Directors of the U.S. Institute of Peace

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S. Res. 21; A resolution supporting the observation of National Trafficking and Modern Slavery Prevention Month during the period beginning on January 1, 2023, and ending on February 1, 2023, to raise awareness of, and opposition to, human trafficking and modern slavery.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation: Roger Israel Zakheim, of Maryland, to be a Member of the Board of Directors of the United States Institute of Peace

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S.Res. 13; A resolution raising awareness and encouraging the prevention of stalking by designating January 2023 as "National Stalking Awareness Month".

vote.title: Confirmation: Brendan Owens, of Virginia, to be an Assistant Secretary of Defense
